Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2010 04:40PM Annabanana1217 wrote: Well, Robin, I can relate.  I, too, am facing yet another chemo let down and after three years of this recurrence, yet another increase in the number of mets to my liver and lungs, and tumor markers over 300, I would consider taking time off, too, but for my family.  I feel, for them, I must fight on as best as I can.  I am now -- I mean literally now -- trying to get a chance at compassionate use of a PARP inhibitor.  I've had too many chemos to qualify for most trials and the one trial I DO qualify for, is full, and everyone is doing so well that no one is dropping out.  (good news; bad news thing)  Between working, family, fatigue, depression (today anyway), and wondering if I'll see Xmas, I fully support your decision to lay off for the summer and really wish I had the courage to do so.  You go girl and once rested maybe it will make more sense -- that is if it ever makes sense.  Best of everything!
Posts.Title: Failure Again...Progression RobinWendy Fidelia
